pepr - SummarizedExperiment interface

Michal Stolarczyk

2018-10-02

peprSummarizedExperimentInterface.Rmd

Introduction

The BiocProject package implements a class that provides an interface for the Project and SummarizedExperiment classes. This way the users of SummarizedExperiment can benefit from the utilties and ideology of the PEP toolkit. Such as:

  • description of all projects the same way, so you only have to learn one metadata structure
  • collaborative work, since the organization is standardized
  • sharing the project with others, who are already familiar with the standard
  • employment of a variety of tools or pipelines without restructuring the metadata
  • analyis attributes of your project in the data analysis environment of your choice (R/python).

How to create the interface?

Load the package

library(BiocProject)

Let’s create an BiocProject object with just the one required argument (PEP config file) and see how it looks like

bp = BiocProject()
bp
#> class: BiocProject 
#> dim: 0 0 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(0):
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames: NULL
#> colData names(0):
#> 
#> PEP project object. Class:  BiocProject
#>   file:  
#>   samples:  0
slotNames(bp)
#> [1] "rowRanges"       "colData"         "assays"          "NAMES"          
#> [5] "elementMetadata" "metadata"        "file"            "samples"        
#> [9] "config"

As you can see, bp the object of class BiocProject consists of the slots of the SummarizedExperiment objects (such as assays, colData etc.) and of class Project (such as samples, config etc.) that are an in-memory representation of a PEP.

Obviously, an empty object of BiocProject class is useless, so let’s consider the following example:

  1. Generate the data for SummarizedExperiment and Project gitcgit
nrows = 200
ncols = 6
counts = matrix(runif(nrows * ncols, 1, 1e4), nrows)
rowRanges = GRanges(rep(c("chr1", "chr2"), c(50, 150)),
                    IRanges(floor(runif(200, 1e5, 1e6)), width=100),
                    strand=sample(c("+", "-"), 200, TRUE),
                    feature_id=sprintf("ID%03d", 1:200))
colData = DataFrame(Treatment=rep(c("ChIP", "Input"), 3),
                    row.names=LETTERS[1:6])

projectConfig = system.file(
"extdata",
"example_peps-master",
"example_implied",
"project_config.yaml",
package = "pepr"
)
  1. Create the BiocProject object and inspect it
bp = BiocProject(file=projectConfig, assays=list(counts=counts), rowRanges=rowRanges, colData=colData)
#> Loaded config file:  
#> /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_implied/project_config.yaml
#> Loading required namespace: data.table
bp
#> class: BiocProject 
#> dim: 200 6 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(1): feature_id
#> colnames(6): A B ... E F
#> colData names(1): Treatment
#> 
#> PEP project object. Class:  BiocProject
#>   file:  
#> /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_implied/project_config.yaml
#>   samples:  6

How to integrate the SummarizedExperiment and Project?

Currently, there are 2 new methods that can integrate the data from Project object with the SummarizedExperiment within the BiocProject objects:
getColData()
It copies the data about samples from samples slot in objects of Project class to the colData slot in the SummarizedExperiment objects.
getMetadata()
It enriches the current metadata section of SummarizedExperiment with the config file that was used to create the Project obejct (PEP).
All inherited methods
Please note, that the “getters and setters” methods associated with the SummarizedExperiment class (rowRanges(), rowData(), colData() etc.) as well as ones associate with the Project class (samples(), config() etc.) are inherited and work with the BiocProject class objects.

To see the above-mentioned methods in use, see the section below:

The current (generated) colData:

colData(bp)
#> DataFrame with 6 rows and 1 column
#>     Treatment
#>   <character>
#> A        ChIP
#> B       Input
#> C        ChIP
#> D       Input
#> E        ChIP
#> F       Input

Copying the colData with the BiocProject methods:

bpModified = getColData(bp)
colData(bpModified)
#> DataFrame with 6 rows and 6 columns
#>   sample_name organism   time                       file_path      genome
#>        <list>   <list> <list>                          <list> <character>
#> 1     frog_0h     frog      0  data/lab/project/frog_0h.fastq            
#> 2     frog_1h     frog      1  data/lab/project/frog_1h.fastq            
#> 3    human_1h    human      1 data/lab/project/human_1h.fastq        hg38
#> 4    human_0h    human      0 data/lab/project/human_0h.fastq        hg38
#> 5    mouse_1h    mouse      1 data/lab/project/mouse_1h.fastq        mm10
#> 6    mouse_0h    mouse      0 data/lab/project/mouse_1h.fastq        mm10
#>   macs_genome_size
#>        <character>
#> 1                 
#> 2                 
#> 3               hs
#> 4               hs
#> 5               mm
#> 6               mm

The current (generated) metadata:

metadata(bp)

Enriched metadata:

bpModified = getMetadata(bp)
metadata(bpModified)
